sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含有"咬，啃"之意。
means: bite ： 指用牙齿钳住或切断，或咬一口。
gnaw ： 指连续不断用齿咬。

word_mean: 弹响，锐声：一种短而尖锐的声音
snap-on contact 利用接触面的一个变形部分使其定位，并保持在确切的轴向位置上的一种推动式接触件。

sentence.Network_en: Then something seemed to snap in me. I couldn't endure any more.
sentence.Network_cn: 这时候，我的心里像有个东西突然绷断了——我再也忍受不了啦。

sentence.Network_en: Often a patient cannot snap out of their negativity that easily.
sentence.Network_cn: 病人常常不能那么容易就打消掉消极的情绪。

sentence.Network_en: I could obtain with the snap of my fingers anything I chose.
sentence.Network_cn: 我不费吹灰之力就可以得到我看中的任何东西。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 而捕捉（SNAP）是捕捉绘图区的辅助栅格点。它们的作用是将十字光标强制性地准确定位在已存在的对象特定点或特定位置上。
大学英语六级词汇表_大学六级 ... snail n． 蜗牛；行动缓慢的人 snap vt． 猛咬，突然折断 sneeze vi． 打喷嚏.
名师丁雪明：2010年考研基础词汇备考札记 ... volunteer vi. 自愿，当志愿 snap n. 吧嗒声，快照‖ snap a. 仓促的，突然的.
Determines if controls should snap to the positioning grid., 确定控件是否应与定位网格对齐.

list.abs: 蕾迪·霍瓦特罗克_百度百科 ... [Scene 6] 实际上迄今为止突如其来的寒流（cold snap）。 [Cold Snap] 寒流（cold snap） [Northen Winner] 北极的胜利者.
PS快捷键_百度百科 ... 13.Snap－（ 对齐） 14.Snap To－（ 对齐到（snap to）） 15.Show Guides－（ 锁定参考线）.
实耐宝(Snapon)又推出更大的可换头扭力扳手,最大可达800NM。可在狭小空间中作业。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal, chiefly N. Amer.)in a moment; almost immediately

lj.lj_ly: gourmet-quality meals are ready in a snap.
lj.lj_ls: 美味佳肴立刻就准备好了。

lj.lj_ly: gourmet-quality meals are ready in a snap.
lj.lj_ls: 美味佳肴立刻就准备好了。

lj.lj_ly: gourmet-quality meals are ready in a snap.
lj.lj_ls: 美味佳肴立刻就准备好了。

jx.jx_en_mean: [often in imperative](informal)get out of (a bad or unhappy mood) by a sudden effort
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)迅速努力从（坏情绪）中恢复过来

lj.lj_ly: come on, Fran—snap out of it!.

jx.jx_en_mean: quickly and eagerly buy or secure something that is in short supply or being sold cheaply

lj.lj_ly: all the tickets have been snapped up.
lj.lj_ls: 所有的票已被抢购一空。

jx.jx_en_mean: To move quickly back to one's normal condition from an undesirable condition, such as depression, grief, or self-pity.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 恢复：迅速从失望、痛快和自我怜悯等不健康状态恢复到平时的状况

phrase.cizu_name: snap out of it【非正式用语】

means.word_mean: 打破;折断
抓住
其他释义

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent. (in the senses 'make a sudden audible bite' and 'quick sharp biting sound'): probably from Middle Dutch or Middle Low German snappen 'seize'; partly imitative

entry.tran: (使)咔嚓一声折断;(使)啪的一声绷断
entry.def: If something snaps or if you snap it, it breaks suddenly, usually with a sharp cracking noise.

example.ex: He shifted his weight and a twig snapped...
example.tran: 他挪了一下身体的重心，一根树枝咔嚓一声断了。

example.ex: The brake pedal had just snapped off...
example.tran: 刹车踏板刚刚啪的一声绷断了。

entry.tran: (使)发出吧嗒一声(合上或打开)
entry.def: If you snap something into a particular position, or if it snaps into that position, it moves quickly into that position, with a sharp sound.

example.tran: 他啪的一声合上了笔记本。

example.ex: He snapped the cap on his ballpoint...
example.tran: 他吧嗒一声把笔帽扣在了圆珠笔上。

entry.def: If you snap your fingers, you make a sharp sound by moving your middle finger quickly across your thumb, for example in order to accompany music or to order someone to do something.

example.ex: She had millions of listeners snapping their fingers to her first single...
example.tran: 百万听众和着她第一首歌的节拍打着响指。

example.ex: He snapped his fingers, and Wilson produced a sheet of paper...
example.tran: 他打了个响指，威尔逊便递过一张纸来。

entry.tran: 恶声恶气地说;声色俱厉地说
entry.def: If someone snaps at you, they speak to you in a sharp, unfriendly way.

example.ex: 'Of course I don't know her,' Roger snapped...
example.tran: 罗杰恶声恶气地说：“我当然不认识她。”

example.ex: I'm sorry, Casey, I didn't mean to snap at you like that.
example.tran: 对不起，凯西，我不是有意要跟你凶的。

entry.tran: 突然精神崩溃;突然失控
entry.def: If someone snaps, or if something snaps inside them, they suddenly stop being calm and become very angry because the situation has become too tense or too difficult for them.

example.ex: He finally snapped when she prevented their children from visiting him one weekend...
example.tran: 当她不准孩子们在某个周末去看他的时候，他终于控制不住自己了。

example.ex: For the first and only time Grant's self-control snapped...
example.tran: 生平第一次也是唯一的一次，格兰特失控了。

entry.def: If an animal such as a dog snaps at you, it opens and shuts its jaws quickly near you, as if it were going to bite you.

example.ex: His teeth clicked as he snapped at my ankle...
example.tran: 它猛地朝我的脚脖子咬下去，牙齿还咔咔直响。

entry.tran: (决定、行动等)突然的，仓促的，鲁莽的
entry.def: A snap decision or action is one that is taken suddenly, often without careful thought.

example.ex: I think this is too important for a snap decision...
example.tran: 我认为，这件事非常重要，不能仓促作决定。

example.ex: It's important not to make snap judgments...
example.tran: 不要急于作出判断——这一点很重要。

example.ex: ...a snap my mother took last year.

entry.def: If you snap someone or something, you take a photograph of them.

example.ex: He was the first ever non-British photographer to be invited to snap a royal.
example.tran: 他是有史以来第一个应邀为王室成员拍照的非英籍摄影师。

entry.tran: “捉对儿”(一种简单的扑克牌游戏，参加者轮流亮牌叠成一叠，争取在出现同点数或同人头的两张牌时，先喊snap以赢得整叠牌)
entry.def: Snap is a simple British card game in which the players take turns to put cards down on a pile, and try to be the first to shout 'snap' when two cards with the same number or picture are put down.

entry.tran: “哟！”(对两件物品相似之极发出的惊叹)
entry.def: You can say 'Snap!' as an expression of surprise when you realize that two things are the same or very similar, for example if you meet a friend wearing the same shirt as you.
A snap is the same as a snap fastener .

means.word_mean: 1. the act of catching an object with the hands;

sentences.sentence: "Mays made the catch with his back to the plate"
"he made a grab for the ball before it landed"
"Martin's snatch at the bridle failed and the horse raced away"
"the infielder's snap and throw was a single motion"

means.word_mean: 2. a spell of cold weather;

sentences.sentence: "a cold snap in the middle of May"

means.word_mean: 3. tender green beans without strings that easily snap into sections
4. a crisp round cookie flavored with ginger
5. the noise produced by the rapid movement of a finger from the tip to the base of the thumb on the same hand;

sentences.sentence: "servants appeared at the snap of his fingers"

means.word_mean: 6. a sudden sharp noise;

sentences.sentence: "he heard the cracking of the ice"
"he can hear the snap of a twig"

means.word_mean: 7. a sudden breaking
8. the tendency of a body to return to its original shape after it has been stretched or compressed;
9. an informal photograph; usually made with a small hand-held camera;

sentences.sentence: "he tried to get unposed shots of his friends"

means.word_mean: 10. a fastener used on clothing; fastens with a snapping sound;

sentences.sentence: "children can manage snaps better than buttons"

means.word_mean: 11. any undertaking that is easy to do;

sentences.sentence: "marketing this product will be no picnic"

means.word_mean: 12. the act of snapping the fingers; movement of a finger from the tip to the base of the thumb on the same hand;
13. (American football) putting the ball in play by passing it (between the legs) to a back;
1. utter in an angry, sharp, or abrupt tone;

sentences.sentence: "The sales clerky snapped a reply at the angry customer"

means.word_mean: 2. separate or cause to separate abruptly;
3. break suddenly and abruptly, as under tension;
4. move or strike with a noise;
5. snap close with a sound;
6. make a sharp sound;
7. move with a snapping sound;
8. to grasp hastily or eagerly;

sentences.sentence: "Before I could stop him the dog snatched the ham bone"

means.word_mean: 9. put in play with a snap;
10. cause to make a snapping sound;
11. lose control of one's emotions;

sentences.sentence: "When she heard that she had not passed the exam, she lost it completely"

means.word_mean: 12. record on photographic film;

sentences.sentence: "I photographed the scene of the accident"
"She snapped a picture of the President"

example.en: The photographer snapped him making a rude gesture.
example.zh: 摄影师把他动作粗野的镜头很快地拍了下来。

example.en: Suddenly Rocko snapped and began heating her savagety.
example.zh: 罗果突然发疯了,开始凶狠地打她。

auth_sentence.content: This isn't any snap decision on my part.
auth_sentence.res_content: This isn't any snap decision on my part.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This isn't any snap decision on my part.

auth_sentence.content: Europeans are taking precautions to survive the cold snap.
auth_sentence.res_content: Europeans are taking precautions to survive the cold snap.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Europeans are taking precautions to survive the cold snap.

auth_sentence.content: With a sharp snap I let the blind-slat drop.
auth_sentence.res_content: With a sharp snap I let the blind-slat drop.

Sentence.sentence: Apple's products are now being snapped up in Delhi and Dalian just as in Dublin and Dallas.
After the personal-savings rate dipped to zero in 2005, the shock of the economic crisis last year prompted people to snap shut their wallets.

means.word_mean: 猛地咬住

sentences.en: The enormous fish snapped the line.

means.word_mean: (使某物)发出尖厉声音地突然断裂[打开, 关闭]

sentences.en: The weight of fish snapped the fishing rod in two.
sentences.cn: 鱼的重量很大, 把鱼竿啪的一声压成两截了。

means.word_mean: 厉声地说
拍…的快照

sentences.en: The photographer snapped a nice photograph of him.
sentences.cn: 摄影师给他拍了一张很棒的快照。

means.word_mean: 使突然中断(或停止)；打断…的谈话

sentences.en: The broadcast was snapped for a few seconds by the sunspot activity.
sentences.cn: 太阳黑子运动使广播突然中断了几秒钟。

means.word_mean: 使迅速行动；急速做出
啪啪作响；发出噼啪声

sentences.en: The driver's whip snapped and our carriage ran fast.
sentences.cn: 赶车人的鞭子发出啪啪声，我们乘坐的马车飞快地向前驶去。

means.word_mean: (牙齿等)咯咯作响；(机器等)发出咔哒咔哒声

sentences.en: My car snapped for a few minutes then wouldn't start.
sentences.cn: 我的汽车咔哒咔哒响了一阵之后，再也发动不起来了。

means.word_mean: (目光)闪耀，闪烁

sentences.en: His eyes snapped when he saw the gold coins in the box.
sentences.cn: 他一看到盒子里的金币，他的双眼一下子亮了起来。

means.word_mean: 迅速抓住；立即接受 (at)

sentences.en: to snap at the last chance
sentences.cn: 迫不及待地抓住最后的时机

means.word_mean: (精神)突然崩溃，突然支持不住

sentences.cn: 她感到再也支持不住了。

jushi.english: After years of hard work and poverty, he finally snapped.
jushi.chinese: 他多年劳累和贫困终因体力不支而病倒。

jushi.english: He stretched the rubber band till it snapped.
jushi.chinese: 他的橡皮筋啪的一声拉断了。
